alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 7:29PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Bucks and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 729 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Souderton, Hatfield, Telford, and Harleysville. - This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 32 and 35. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
